title:
Circuit Implementation of Discrete-Time Quantum Walks on Complex
  Networks
abstract:
In this paper, we propose a circuit design for implementing quantum walks on
complex networks. Quantum walks are powerful tools for various graph-based
applications such as spatial search, community detection, and node
classification. Although many quantum-walk-based graph algorithms have been
extensively studied, specific quantum circuits for implementing these
algorithms have not yet been provided. To address this issue, we present a
circuit design for implementing the discrete-time quantum walk on complex
networks. We investigate the functionality of our circuit using the small-sized
Watts-and-Strogatz model as the complex network model, comparing it with
theoretical calculations. This work offers a new approach to constructing
quantum circuits for implementing quantum walks on arbitrary complex networks.
